oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Programmable function generators - I: base five-bar mechanism
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SETH, B
VADDI, SS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: 5-bar
programmable
hybrid
mechanism
five-bar
function generator
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The concept of programmable function generator mechanisms is introduced here. A multi-degree of freedom (DOF) closed chain mechanism can be termed a programmable mechanism, if the motion corresponding to at least one DOF is controlled to influence the output motion. The five-bar, two-DOF planar mechanism, which constitutes a base for synthesizing the simplest programmable function generator mechanisms, is studied here. Design considerations, such as determinate kinematics, link dimensions, selection of coupler-point and control-input, are discussed. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: National Conference on Machines and Mechanisms (NaCoMM-99),BOMBAY, INDIA,DEC 16-17, 1999
